Sub Job Family Description:
Researches, develops, plans, designs, maintains and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's relations with the community, the public, government and regulatory authorities, shareholders and employees. Responsibilities are within the Corporate Affairs/Communications function as a generalist or in a combination of disciplines.
Develops and coordinates lines of communication within the organization among employees. Implements policies and programs to increase employee awareness and knowledge of activities affecting employees.
May have responsibility for managing programs aimed at promoting Diversity, Equity and Inclusion.
Job Profile Description: Researches, develops, plans, designs, maintains and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's relations with the community, the public, government and regulatory authorities, shareholders and employees | Responsibilities are within the Corporate Affairs/Communications Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Looks beyond existing methodologies and own discipline to define and resolve complex problems
● Develops plans and delivers results in fast-changing businesses and/or regulatory environments
● Provides input to functional or departmental strategy
● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Sub Job Family Description:
Researches, develops, plans, designs, maintains and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's relations with the community, the public, government and regulatory authorities, shareholders and employees. Responsibilities are within the Corporate Affairs/Communications function as a generalist or in a combination of disciplines.
Develops and coordinates lines of communication within the organization among employees. Implements policies and programs to increase employee awareness and knowledge of activities affecting employees.
May have responsibility for managing programs aimed at promoting Diversity, Equity and Inclusion.
Job Profile Description: Researches, develops, plans, designs, maintains and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's relations with the community, the public, government and regulatory authorities, shareholders and employees | Responsibilities are within the Corporate Affairs/Communications Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 15+ years of work experience or equivalent
Extensive leadership experience of a major, business critical and strategic segment

Job Profile Description: Researches, develops, plans, designs, maintains and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's relations with the community, the public, government and regulatory authorities, shareholders and employees | Responsibilities are within the Corporate Affairs/Communications Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Manages professional employees and/or supervisors or supervises large, complex support, production or operations team(s)
● Has accountability for the performance and results of a team within own discipline or function
● Adapts departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges
● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager
● Provides technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers
Grade Differentiatior:
● Accountable for the budget, performance and results of a medium-sized team or multiple small teams of employees
● Exercises full management authority, including performance reviews, pay decisions, recruitment, discipline, termination and other personnel actions
● Addresses issues with impact beyond own team based on knowledge of related disciplines

Sub Job Family Description:
Researches, develops, plans, designs, maintains and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's relations with the community, the public, government and regulatory authorities, shareholders and employees. Job Profile Description: Researches, develops, plans, designs, maintains and implements policies and programs that enhance the organization's relations with the community, the public, government and regulatory authorities, shareholders and employees | Responsibilities are within the Corporate Affairs/Communications Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Has in-depth knowledge in own discipline and basic knowledge of related disciplines
● Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions
● Works independently; receives minimal guidance
● May lead projects or project steps within a broader project or have accountability for ongoing activities or objectives
● Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience
● May represent the level at which career may stabilize for many years or even until retirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products/services or processes
● Typically resolves complex problems or problems where precedent may not exist
● Often leads the work of small project teams; may formally train other employees (more junior and/or senior)
● Works independently
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 4-8 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Initial experience in functionally leading (sub-) projects

Sub Job Family Description: Develops and maintains policies and programs to ensure organizational awareness of government legislation and/or regulatory issues that affect the organization and respond to same. Ensures that the organization's interests are represented and protected in legislative proceedings and in the development of market rules and procedures. Prepares and organizes forums and gatherings with government officials to exchange ideas and information on business activities and potential legislation that may affect the organization. Acts as a resource on regulatory matters with regard to product changes. Also positions with focus on public relations, coordinating media relations and preparing external communication, and regulatory affairs which maintain relationships with regulatory authorities and external parties, are covered here.

Sub Job Family: Sustainability / Enviromental, Social and Governance Affairs
Job Profile: Sustainability / Enviromental, Social and Governance Affairs
SIG Full Title: Senior Group Manager Sustainability / Enviromental, Social and Governance Affairs
Sub Job Family Description:
Plans, implements, and oversees the organization's environmental, social, and governance (ESG) initiatives in conjunction with sustainability programs. Delivers positive environmental outcomes, advancing social responsibility, and ensuring governance compliance. Manages key external stakeholders to align and advance the organization's ESG and sustainability goals. Strategically develops and communicates the organization's cohesive ESG and sustainability vision, while monitoring and guiding the progress of both ESG and sustainability programs in line with established strategies, goals, measurements, and reporting standards.
Develops a commercial role by linking SIG's responsibility strategy to the specific needs of each customer, through the initiatives, benefits, or unique features of the products.
Job Profile Description: Develops and implements the organization's positions on environmental policy issues regarding the impact of the organization's operations on water, air and land quality | Designs and implements programs to ensure healthful and safe working conditions and compliance with all environmental regulations, including clean air and hazardous waste disposal, on the organization's premises | Serves as a liaison with external government environmental agencies | Monitors programs and maintains up-to-date records required by environmental permits to ensure government compliance
Role Description:
● Holds management accountability for a business, division, major geography, corporate function or major corporate sub-function
● Develops, establishes and approves long-term vision and strategy for the area managed
● May be a board or executive committee member or have a comparable level of influence
Grade Differentiatior:
● Typically reports to the head of a subregion, country, division or function
● In large organizations (Global Grade 20 to 22), heads an infrastructure function with indirect impact on business performance
● Provides leadership and direction through Senior Managers and Managers respectively Senior Experts and Experts
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10-15 years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in management of a global function or major region including setting the respective strategy

Role Description:
● Manages professional employees and/or supervisors or supervises large, complex support, production or operations team(s)
● Has accountability for the performance and results of a team within own discipline or function
● Adapts departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges
● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager
● Provides technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers
Grade Differentiatior:
● Accountable for the budget, performance and results of a medium-sized team or multiple small teams of employees
● Exercises full management authority, including performance reviews, pay decisions, recruitment, discipline, termination and other personnel actions
● Addresses issues with impact beyond own team based on knowledge of related disciplines

Sub Job Family Description:
The Controlling profiles encompass two key areas: Commercial Controlling and Cost Controlling (COGS / SG&A). 
In Commercial Controlling, the focus lies on analyzing new customer projects, capital investments, and price changes to optimize performance parameters and maximize shareholder value.  Supports negotiation preparations, scenario modeling, and portfolio analysis across various dimensions, providing strategic recommendations to management. Additionally, it may assist product management in assessing new product launches, including Net Present Value and Internal Rate of Return.

Cost Controlling (COGS / SG&A) specializes in the analysis of supply network and/or infrastructure projects, including capital investments and shareholder value optimization. Supports supply chain and supplier-facing functions in conducting in-depth cost and working capital analysis, and overseeing cost and working capital control. This includes monitoring deviations from past performance, forecasts, and budgets, along with trend analysis and recommendations for improvement.

In both global and regional roles, coordinates and monitors these core processes within their respective organizations, contributing to strategic decision-making and financial performance enhancement.
Job Profile Description: Performs economic research and studies of rates of return, depreciation and investments | Analyzes profit-and-loss income statements and prepares reports and recommendations to management | Generates forecasts and analyzes trends in sales, finance and other areas of business | Researches economic progressions to assist the organization's financial planning | Creates financial models of "what if" scenarios for future business planning decisions in areas such as new product development, new marketing strategies, etc.
Role Description:
● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Looks beyond existing methodologies and own discipline to define and resolve complex problems
● Develops plans and delivers results in fast-changing businesses and/or regulatory environments
● Provides input to functional or departmental strategy
● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Additionally, it may assist product management in assessing new product launches, including Net Present Value and Internal Rate of Return.

Cost Controlling (COGS / SG&A) specializes in the analysis of supply network and/or infrastructure projects, including capital investments and shareholder value optimization. Supports supply chain and supplier-facing functions in conducting in-depth cost and working capital analysis, and overseeing cost and working capital control. This includes monitoring deviations from past performance, forecasts, and budgets, along with trend analysis and recommendations for improvement.

In both global and regional roles, coordinates and monitors these core processes within their respective organizations, contributing to strategic decision-making and financial performance enhancement.

Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement

The Controlling profiles encompass two key areas: Commercial Controlling and Cost Controlling (COGS / SG&A). 
In Commercial Controlling, the focus lies on analyzing new customer projects, capital investments, and price changes to optimize performance parameters and maximize shareholder value.  Supports negotiation preparations, scenario modeling, and portfolio analysis across various dimensions, providing strategic recommendations to management. Additionally, it may assist product management in assessing new product launches, including Net Present Value and Internal Rate of Return.

Cost Controlling (COGS / SG&A) specializes in the analysis of supply network and/or infrastructure projects, including capital investments and shareholder value optimization. Supports supply chain and supplier-facing functions in conducting in-depth cost and working capital analysis, and overseeing cost and working capital control. This includes monitoring deviations from past performance, forecasts, and budgets, along with trend analysis and recommendations for improvement.

In both global and regional roles, coordinates and monitors these core processes within their respective organizations, contributing to strategic decision-making and financial performance enhancement.
Job Profile Description: Performs economic research and studies of rates of return, depreciation and investments | Analyzes profit-and-loss income statements and prepares reports and recommendations to management | Generates forecasts and analyzes trends in sales, finance and other areas of business | Researches economic progressions to assist the organization's financial planning | Creates financial models of "what if" scenarios for future business planning decisions in areas such as new product development, new marketing strategies, etc.
Role Description:
● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Identifies applications of functional knowledge and existing methodologies to complex problems
● Manages large teams of professionals and/or junior managers
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

SIG Full Title: Senior Manager Finance IT Systems & Tools (ERP & BI)
Sub Job Family Description:
Performs detailed review, design, development and implementation of financial systems (ERP and BI; both manual and computerized), systems documentation and procedures/instructions | Possesses broad financial knowledge and works closely with other disciplines (e.g., accountants, tax, treasury) | Liaises closely with colleagues in information technology | Plays a key role in ensuring systems operate effectively.
Takes care that all subject related requirements (compliance, accounting rules and guidelines, where relevant) as well as global standardization are covered by the respective ERP/IT-solution. Possess in-depth knowledge of the SIG-specific system business and the associated value flows in our ERP- or other IT systems as well as broad finance expertise to ensure global, standardized value flows for management- or external accounting as well as financial KPIs. In addition acts as an expert and power user of SIG’s ERP system [SAP] or other finance systems. Has a broader understanding of full cross functional processes like “purchase to pay”, “order to cash” etc. to assess the impact of new IT-solutions cross-functionally.  
Analyzes and monitors effectiveness and efficiency of organization’s business intelligence, reporting & analytics systems and processes, initiates and conducts improvements as needed.
Setup, maintenance, issue resolution and modernization of global reporting and analytics tools in alignment with key user organizations acting as internal customers
Management of improvement projects’ pipeline for technical improvements as well as architecture planning and upgrades, including system documentation and procedures Trains the system users on all aspects of organization’s business intelligence, reporting & analytics systems.

● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Looks beyond existing methodologies and own discipline to define and resolve complex problems
● Develops plans and delivers results in fast-changing businesses and/or regulatory environments
● Provides input to functional or departmental strategy
● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Setup, maintenance, issue resolution and modernization of global reporting and analytics tools in alignment with key user organizations acting as internal customers
Management of improvement projects’ pipeline for technical improvements as well as architecture planning and upgrades, including system documentation and procedures Trains the system users on all aspects of organization’s business intelligence, reporting & analytics systems.
Job Profile Description:
Performs detailed review, design, development and implementation of financial systems (ERP and BI; both manual and computerized), systems documentation and procedures/instructions | Possesses broad financial knowledge and works closely with other disciplines (e.g., accountants, tax, treasury) | Liaises closely with colleagues in information technology | Plays a key role in ensuring systems operate effectively.
Takes care that all subject related requirements (compliance, accounting rules and guidelines, where relevant) as well as global standardization are covered by the respective ERP/IT-solution. Possess in-depth knowledge of the SIG-specific system business and the associated value flows in our ERP- or other IT systems as well as broad finance expertise to ensure global, standardized value flows for management- or external accounting as well as financial KPIs. In addition acts as an expert and power user of SIG’s ERP system [SAP] or other finance systems. Has a broader understanding of full cross functional processes like “purchase to pay”, “order to cash” etc. to assess the impact of new IT-solutions cross-functionally.  
Analyzes and monitors effectiveness and efficiency of organization’s business intelligence, reporting & analytics systems and processes, initiates and conducts improvements as needed.
Setup, maintenance, issue resolution and modernization of global reporting and analytics tools in alignment with key user organizations acting as internal customers
Management of improvement projects’ pipeline for technical improvements as well as architecture planning and upgrades, including system documentation and procedures Trains the system users on all aspects of organization’s business intelligence, reporting & analytics systems.
Role Description:
● Has working knowledge and experience in own discipline
● Continues to build knowledge of the organization, processes and customers
● Performs a range of mainly straightforward assignments
● Uses prescribed guidelines or policies to analyze and resolve problems
● Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction

● May have limited work experience involving basic concepts and procedures
● Develops competence by performing structured work assignments
● Uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems
● Works under supervision and direction from more senior level roles

Sub Job Family Description:
Performs a variety of financial activities, including accounting, financial analysis, audit, tax, credit and collections. Develops and evaluates financial plans and policies. Establishes and maintains accounting, financial, and reporting policies and controls.
General Finance covers those roles that are broader than the defined Sub-Job Families (i.e. Accounting, Controlling, Tax etc.). Job profiles can equally be a group function and a regional role. These job profiles cover those individuals that are also executing tasks in multiple Finance areas.
Job Profile Description:
Performs a variety of financial activities, including accounting, financial analysis, audit, tax, credit and collections | Develops and evaluates financial plans and policies | Establishes and maintains accounting, financial, and reporting policies and controls.
Supports the company’s executive board in executing group / regional strategy. Develops and executes on the group/regional financial priorities (building on the analysis of the past performance and influencing the future performance). Performs management reporting and controlling activities and steers structural improvements across key Company’s financial performance drivers. Leads, designs/develops and executes group/regional projects to further enhance the group and the finance function.  Develops and maintains best in class external reporting including but not limited to, finance, compliance and sustainability. Maintains and develops relationships with external partners. May drive global initiatives.
Role Description:
● Provides leadership and direction through Senior Managers and Managers
● Has accountability for the performance and results of:
● A large, strategically important discipline in an extremely large market; and/or
● Related disciplines or a medium-sized function in a large market or medium-sized division; and/or
● A medium-sized discipline or department in a major region
● Adapts and executes functional or departmental business plans and contributes to the development of functional or departmental strategies
● Decisions are guided by functional or major operational segment strategies and priorities
Grade Differentiatior:
● Provides leadership and direction through Senior Managers and Managers respectively Senior Experts and Experts
● Has accountability for the performance and results of:
● A large, strategically important discipline in an extremely large market; and/or
● Related disciplines or a medium-sized function in a large market or medium-sized division; and/or
● A medium-sized discipline or department in a major region
● Adapts and executes functional or departmental business plans and contributes to the development of functional or departmental strategies
● Decisions are guided by functional or major operational segment strategies and priorities
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 2-4 years of work experience or
  equivalent
Specific parameters KPIs:
University degree or equivalent and 10-15 years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in management of a global function or major region including setting the respective strategy

Sub Job Family Description:
Performs a variety of financial activities, including accounting, financial analysis, audit, tax, credit and collections. Develops and evaluates financial plans and policies. Establishes and maintains accounting, financial, and reporting policies and controls.
General Finance covers those roles that are broader than the defined Sub-Job Families (i.e. Accounting, Controlling, Tax etc.). Job profiles can equally be a group function and a regional role. These job profiles cover those individuals that are also executing tasks in multiple Finance areas.
Job Profile Description:
Performs a variety of financial activities, including accounting, financial analysis, audit, tax, credit and collections | Develops and evaluates financial plans and policies | Establishes and maintains accounting, financial, and reporting policies and controls.
Supports the company’s executive board in executing group / regional strategy. Develops and executes on the group/regional financial priorities (building on the analysis of the past performance and influencing the future performance). Performs management reporting and controlling activities and steers structural improvements across key Company’s financial performance drivers. Leads, designs/develops and executes group/regional projects to further enhance the group and the finance function.  Develops and maintains best in class external reporting including but not limited to, finance, compliance and sustainability. Maintains and develops relationships with external partners. May drive global initiatives.
Role Description:
● Manages professional employees and/or supervisors or supervises large, complex support, production or operations team(s)
● Has accountability for the performance and results of a team within own discipline or function
● Adapts departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges
● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager
● Provides technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers
Grade Differentiatior:
● Accountable for results of a small team of employees
● Exercises limited management authority; sets employee performance objectives, conducts performance reviews and recommends pay actions
● Defines team operating standards and ensures essential procedures are followed based on knowledge of own discipline
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 7-10 years of work experience or equivalent
Experience in managing mixed-level team(s) of professionals and subordinate managers

Sub Job Family Description:
Performs a variety of financial activities, including accounting, financial analysis, audit, tax, credit and collections. Develops and evaluates financial plans and policies. Establishes and maintains accounting, financial, and reporting policies and controls.
General Finance covers those roles that are broader than the defined Sub-Job Families (i.e. Accounting, Controlling, Tax etc.). Job profiles can equally be a group function and a regional role. These job profiles cover those individuals that are also executing tasks in multiple Finance areas.
Job Profile Description:
Performs a variety of financial activities, including accounting, financial analysis, audit, tax, credit and collections | Develops and evaluates financial plans and policies | Establishes and maintains accounting, financial, and reporting policies and controls.
Supports the company’s executive board in executing group / regional strategy. Develops and executes on the group/regional financial priorities (building on the analysis of the past performance and influencing the future performance). Performs management reporting and controlling activities and steers structural improvements across key Company’s financial performance drivers. Leads, designs/develops and executes group/regional projects to further enhance the group and the finance function.  Develops and maintains best in class external reporting including but not limited to, finance, compliance and sustainability. Maintains and develops relationships with external partners. May drive global initiatives.
Role Description:
● Coordinates and supervises the daily activities of typically a support, production or operations team
● Sets priorities for the team to ensure task completion; coordinates work activities with other supervisors
● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance and oversight from manager
● Typically does not spend more than 20% of time performing the work supervised
Grade Differentiatior:
● Accountable for the results of a large and/or moderately complex support or production operations team including subordinate work leaders
● Applies acquired expertise to analyze and solve problems without clear precedent
● Provides input on resource planning and policy development
● Coaches team members on performance, completes employee performance evaluations and recommends pay actions
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 8-10 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Experience in functionally leading (sub-)projects / teams

Sub Job Family Description: Design, develop and implement long-term tax strategies that are aligned with company's business strategy and financial goals, taking into account analyses of existing and upcoming international and local tax legislations. Responsible for tax reporting which involves analysis of effective tax rate, return to provision, deferred and current tax calculation, and relevant disclosures. Responsible for tax compliance which may include: preparing and maintaining tax records and returns, indirect tax compliance, and transfer pricing documentation. Responsible for developing audit defense strategy and represent the company in tax audit disucssion, settlement negotiation and tax litigation to defend the company's tax position. Devise tax model through planning activities to ensure tax optimization in acccordance with tax laws and regulations. Conduct research as necessary to advise management and business  of tax implications resulting from changes in tax legislations. Identify opportunites incl. tax credts and incentives and recommend / implement respective treatments to alleviate or reduce tax burdens.

Role Description:
● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Looks beyond existing methodologies and own discipline to define and resolve complex problems
● Develops plans and delivers results in fast-changing businesses and/or regulatory environments
● Provides input to functional or departmental strategy
● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 8-10 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Experience in functionally leading (sub-)projects / teams

Sub Job Family Description: Design, develop and implement long-term tax strategies that are aligned with company's business strategy and financial goals, taking into account analyses of existing and upcoming international and local tax legislations. Responsible for tax reporting which involves analysis of effective tax rate, return to provision, deferred and current tax calculation, and relevant disclosures. Responsible for tax compliance which may include: preparing and maintaining tax records and returns, indirect tax compliance, and transfer pricing documentation. Responsible for developing audit defense strategy and represent the company in tax audit disucssion, settlement negotiation and tax litigation to defend the company's tax position. Devise tax model through planning activities to ensure tax optimization in acccordance with tax laws and regulations. Conduct research as necessary to advise management and business  of tax implications resulting from changes in tax legislations. Identify opportunites incl. tax credts and incentives and recommend / implement respective treatments to alleviate or reduce tax burdens.

Sub Job Family Description: Performs treasury operations involving cash funds, foreign exchange, debt and capital management. Provides analytical and technical support to treasury-related activities.
Job Profile Description: Performs treasury operations involving cash funds, foreign exchange, debt and capital management | Provides analytical and technical support to treasury-related activities
Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 8-10 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Experience in functionally leading (sub-)projects / teams

● Manages professional employees and/or supervisors or supervises large, complex support, production or operations team(s)

● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager
● Provides technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers

SIG Full Title: Program Manager Business IT/ Digital Projects
Sub Job Family Description: Manages all aspects of a diverse business IT project or multiple IT projects, typically involving multiple Disciplines in the business IT Function. Utilizes expertise, stakeholder management and leadership skills to direct staff and to resolve issues to ensure project goals and requirements are met. Typically uses development techniques and tools for team collaboration, issue tracking and backlog management
Job Profile Description: Manages all aspects of a diverse business IT project or multiple IT projects, typically involving multiple Disciplines in the business IT Function | Utilizes expertise, stakeholder management and leadership skills to direct staff and to resolve issues to ensure project goals and requirements are met | Typically uses development techniques and tools for team collaboration, issue tracking and backlog management
Role Description:
● Provides leadership and direction through Senior Managers and Managers
● Has accountability for the performance and results of:
● A large, strategically important discipline in an extremely large market; and/or
● Related disciplines or a medium-sized function in a large market or medium-sized division; and/or
● A medium-sized discipline or department in a major region
● Adapts and executes functional or departmental business plans and contributes to the development of functional or departmental strategies
● Decisions are guided by functional or major operational segment strategies and priorities
Grade Differentiatior:
● Provides leadership and direction through Senior Managers and Managers respectively Senior Experts and Experts
● Has accountability for the performance and results of:
● A large, strategically important discipline in an extremely large market; and/or
● Related disciplines or a medium-sized function in a large market or medium-sized division; and/or
● A medium-sized discipline or department in a major region
● Adapts and executes functional or departmental business plans and contributes to the development of functional or departmental strategies
● Decisions are guided by functional or major operational segment strategies and priorities
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 2-4 years of work experience or
  equivalent
Specific parameters KPIs:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent, 
Very experienced in functionally leading cross-functional projects

Very experienced in functionally leading cross-functional projects

Sub Job Family Description: Manages IT security risks, controls, Identity Access Management and IT Compliance. Ensures protection of information and IT infrastructure by designing and implementing an information security landscape, promoting cyber security and adequate human behavior, conducting security assessments and resolving security incidents as well as recommending enhancements to improve security. Develops and enforces general technical, procedural and operational IT guidelines.
Job Profile Description: Evaluates, tests, monitors and maintains information systems (IS), IT controls and cyber security policies, procedures and systems I Creates, implements and oversees identity management systems to meet specific security needs and complex compliance standards | Ensures that IS and cyber security plans, controls, processes, standards, policies and procedures are aligned with IS standards and overall IS and cyber security | Identifies security risks and exposures, determines the causes of security violations and suggests procedures to halt future incidents and improve security | Develops techniques and procedures for conducting IS, cyber security and access and identity risk assessments and compliance audits, the evaluation and testing of hardware, firmware and software for possible impact on system security, and the investigation and resolution of security incidents such as intrusion, frauds, attacks or leaks
Role Description:
● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Looks beyond existing methodologies and own discipline to define and resolve complex problems
● Develops plans and delivers results in fast-changing businesses and/or regulatory environments
● Provides input to functional or departmental strategy
● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Sub Job Family Description: Designs, develops, codes, tests, debugs and/or customizes information technology (IT) solutions for own business or external clients | Applies best practices and advanced methodologies, to address and prioritize customer requirements business processes, changing development and technology environments .

● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility

University degree or equivalent and 4-8 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Initial experience in functionally leading (sub-) projects

● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives

● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals

Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Sub Job Family Description: Ensures the effectiveness of internal controls in compliance with corporate objectives and policies. Reviews, evaluates, develops, implements, maintains and verifies internal and business controls for processes, systems, financial statements, operational processes and information security in accordance with internal auditing standards, policies, procedures & regulations. Identifies internal control gaps in business procedures, processes or systems and initiates appropriate remedial action. Ensures that documentation for all processes across the organization is reviewed and updated periodically. May coordinate with external auditors to prepare the attestation of management assessment on internal controls.
Job Profile Description: Develops, plans and evaluates internal audit programs for the organization's records and the activities of various departments to ensure compliance with the organization's policies, procedures and standards |Prepares reports for management on the results of audits, providing recommendations on improvements | Interfaces with and assists outside auditors to expedite their work
Role Description:
● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Identifies applications of functional knowledge and existing methodologies to complex problems
● Manages large teams of professionals and/or junior managers
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Sub Job Family Description:
Legal Affairs: Provides a full range of legal advice and services. Creates efficient monitoring systems and incentives to ensure that executive behavior aligns with the interests of stakeholders. Plans and monitors relationships among stakeholders, Board of Directors, executive officers and independent auditors to ensure compliance with rules and policies of the organization. Identifies and resolves issues and recommends preventive and corrective measures. Ensures the organization complies with legal and regulatory requirements of the countries in which operates. 

Compliance: Defines and documents policies and procedures related to ensure compliance with applicable legislation/regulation. Develops, implements and communicates a global compliance program & strategy. Activities include compliance risk assessment and mitigation, monitoring, development, monitoring and revision of policies and procedures, investigation of compliance incidents and training and communication on compliance topics.
Job Profile Description: Provides a full range of legal advice and services | Responsibilities are within the Legal Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Holds management accountability for a business, division, major geography, corporate function or major corporate sub-function
● Develops, establishes and approves long-term vision and strategy for the area managed
● May be a board or executive committee member or have a comparable level of influence
Grade Differentiatior:
● Typically reports to the head of a subregion, country, division or function
● In large organizations (Survey Grade 20 to 22), heads a large or key function with a direct impact on business unit performance; sets functional strategy and significantly influences overall business unit strategy
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 15+ years of work experience or equivalent
Extensive leadership experience of a major, business critical and strategic segment

Sub Job Family Description:
Legal Affairs: Provides a full range of legal advice and services. Creates efficient monitoring systems and incentives to ensure that executive behavior aligns with the interests of stakeholders. Job Profile Description: Provides a full range of legal advice and services | Responsibilities are within the Legal Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 4-8 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Initial experience in functionally leading (sub-) projects

Sub Job Family Description: Develops marketing, merchandising and creative strategies and affiliated programs to promote the organization's products and services through the internet or other digital channels to increase exposure to and business from the target audience. Manages the implementation of digital marketing programs and analyzes their effectiveness. Establishes and manages the relationships with search engines and portal sites that are strategically aligned with the digital goals. Tracks usage trends of the organization's websites, including number and quality of visitors and advertising campaign impact. Develops and maintains website graphic designs and layout to support the organization's image, identity and brands through a diverse mix of web material, graphical user interfaces and multimedia delivered for the web. Ensures that the organization's website provides up-to-date and comprehensive product/service information that is easily available to existing and potential customers. May be responsible for social media marketing and online community management.

● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units

● Looks beyond existing methodologies and own discipline to define and resolve complex problems

● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Sub Job Family Description: Designs, develops and implements marketing programs and/or pricing strategies to support the organization's products, services or market sector. Sub Job Family Description: Performs analysis and prepares forecasts and recommendations in the areas of product preferences, sales coverage, market penetration, market practices and sales trends. Researches market conditions to determine potential sales of a product.  Collects, analyzes and uses quantitative and qualitative market data to develop insights into consumer preferences, behaviors, patterns and trends and to understand perception and drivers of consumer /market dynamics. Employs methods such as consumer/ user panels, focus groups, surveys and data mining and modeling. Provides insights to aid the development of future programs/strategy. Monitors organization's market share and competition.

Sub Job Family Description: Systematize and optimize process parameters and process specifications. Define processing requirements for new and further devlopment of manufacturing processes. Sets up equipment feeding, speed and temperature for optimal performance. Selects and measures raw materials and parts to specifications to prepare for production processing. Resolves issues related to the organization's production, machinery, processing and/or packaging operations. May monitor meters, gauges, valves, flow ratios, temperatures, pressures, and related controls and guidelines to ensure adherence to production/process specifications in support of maintenance engineering. Reports any malfunctions or abnormalities and makes minor adjustments and repairs to equipment. Performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures. Drives innovations, digitalization and continuous improvement of operations.

Drives innovations, digitalization and continuous improvement of operations.

Sub Job Family Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs. Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management. HR generalists are responsible for the deployment of all HR strategy processes and act as a business partner to operational staff.  Their role covers all or a large part of HR activities. Also HR Business Partnering positions and positions with regards to Labor Relations are covered here.
Job Profile Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs | Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management | Responsibilities are within the Human Resources Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Looks beyond existing methodologies and own discipline to define and resolve complex problems
● Develops plans and delivers results in fast-changing businesses and/or regulatory environments
● Provides input to functional or departmental strategy
● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Sub Job Family Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs. Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management. HR generalists are responsible for the deployment of all HR strategy processes and act as a business partner to operational staff.  Their role covers all or a large part of HR activities. Also HR Business Partnering positions and positions with regards to Labor Relations are covered here.
Job Profile Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs | Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management | Responsibilities are within the Human Resources Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines

● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:
● Identifies applications of functional knowledge and existing methodologies to complex problems
● Manages large teams of professionals and/or junior managers
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

Sub Job Family Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs. Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management. HR generalists are responsible for the deployment of all HR strategy processes and act as a business partner to employees of all levels of the organization. Their role covers all or a large part of HR activities. Includes responsibility for HR Business Partnering & Labour Relations.
Job Profile Description: Works closely with senior management within specific business units or regions to develop and implement predominately medium to long-term HR solutions aligned to business strategy | Supported by centralized HR professionals who have specialized in particular functions
Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 4-8 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Initial experience in functionally leading (sub-) projects

Sub Job Family Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs. Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management. HR generalists are responsible for the deployment of all HR strategy processes and act as a business partner to operational staff.  Their role covers all or a large part of HR activities. Also HR Business Partnering positions and positions with regards to Labor Relations are covered here.
Job Profile Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs | Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management | Responsibilities are within the Human Resources Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Manages professional employees and/or supervisors or supervises large, complex support, production or operations team(s)
● Has accountability for the performance and results of a team within own discipline or function
● Adapts departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges
● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager
● Provides technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers
Grade Differentiatior:
● Accountable for the budget, performance and results of a medium-sized team or multiple small teams of employees
● Exercises full management authority, including performance reviews, pay decisions, recruitment, discipline, termination and other personnel actions
● Addresses issues with impact beyond own team based on knowledge of related disciplines

● Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions
● Works independently; receives minimal guidance

Sub Job Family Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs. Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management. HR generalists are responsible for the deployment of all HR strategy processes and act as a business partner to operational staff.  Their role covers all or a large part of HR activities. Also HR Business Partnering positions and positions with regards to Labor Relations are covered here.
Job Profile Description: Designs, implements and monitors a variety of human resource programs | Anticipates and plans for long-term human resource needs and trends in partnership with business management | Responsibilities are within the Human Resources Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines

Acquires knowledge in relevant topics, processes, and workflows during an apprenticeship to learn the respective profession or gains basic knowledge and work experience during internship. 
Participates in or contributes to activities and or projects of the respective team. 
Typically, has not achieved a formal qualification yet related to specified working field.
May be working as technical apprentice in the maintenance area or as commercial/ administrative apprentice in the sales/ business supporting areas.

Sub Job Family Description: Processes the organization's human resource information using the most efficient and cost-effective computer systems and applications. Researches, analyzes, designs and maintains information systems in support of human resource administration and projects. EcoVadis).
Job Profile Description: Processes the organization's human resource information using the most efficient and cost-effective computer systems and applications | Researches, analyzes, designs and maintains information systems in support of human resource administration and projects | Monitors HR information needs and designs new or modifies existing systems to meet changing requirements
Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 4-8 years of work experience or equivalent, 
Initial experience in functionally leading (sub-) projects

SIG Full Title: Senior Expert Total Rewards/ Compensation & Benefits
Sub Job Family Description: Plans, designs, evaluates, administers and implement employee compensation and benefit programs such as salaries, short- and long-term incentives, job evaluations, performance appraisals, salary increases and salary surveys, retirement plans, and life, health and disability insurance. May identify and incorporate environmental, social and governance (ESG) and diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) considerations into compensation and benefit programs. Provides governance and oversees compliance of such programs.
Job Profile Description: Plans, designs, evaluates and administers employee compensation and benefit programs such as salaries, short- and long-term incentives, job evaluations, performance appraisals, retirement plans, and life, health and disability insurance
Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications: University degree or equivalent and 2-4 years of work experience or equivalent

Sub Job Family Description: Plans, designs, evaluates, administers and implement employee compensation and benefit programs such as salaries, short- and long-term incentives, job evaluations, performance appraisals, salary increases and salary surveys, retirement plans, and life, health and disability insurance. Provides governance and oversees compliance of such programs.
Job Profile Description: Plans, designs, evaluates and administers employee compensation and benefit programs such as salaries, short- and long-term incentives, job evaluations, performance appraisals, retirement plans, and life, health and disability insurance
Role Description:
● Manages professional employees and/or supervisors or supervises large, complex support, production or operations team(s)
● Has accountability for the performance and results of a team within own discipline or function
● Adapts departmental plans and priorities to address resource and operational challenges
● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager
● Provides technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers
Grade Differentiatior:
● Accountable for the budget, performance and results of a medium-sized team or multiple small teams of employees
● Exercises full management authority, including performance reviews, pay decisions, recruitment, discipline, termination and other personnel actions
● Addresses issues with impact beyond own team based on knowledge of related disciplines

Sub Job Family Description:
Develops and implements the organization's positions on environmental policy issues regarding the impact of the organization's operations on water, air and land quality. Designs and implements programs to ensure healthful and safe working conditions and compliance with all environmental regulations, including clean air and hazardous waste disposal, on the organization's premises. Serves as a liaison with external government environmental agencies. Monitors programs and maintains up-to-date records required by environmental permits to ensure government compliance.

And/or designs, develops, implements and oversees the organization's safety or preventive health care programs to safeguard employees. Ensures that all facilities and safety equipement are in compliance with regulations, fire safety standards. Determine and provide employees with safety training and/or medical care/nursing care for the comfort and well-being of employees. Conducts studies and investigations and prepares regular reports/ statistics of e.g. accidents and indicidents to determine the root cause and to develop recommendations for prevention. Develops and provides safety performance measures for monitoring. Maintains comprehensive knowledge of government safety and fire safety regulations or occupation health.
Job Profile Description: Designs, develops, implements and oversees the organization's environmental, health and safety programs and procedures to safeguard employees and surrounding communities and to ensure that all facilities are in compliance with regulations | Responsibilities are within the Environmental Health and Safety Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization
● Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
● Interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices
● Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify solutions
● May lead functional teams or projects
● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement
Grade Differentiatior:
● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline
● Applies working knowledge of the theories and concepts in other disciplines
● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 5-7 years of work experience or equivalent
Experienced in application of management techniques
Experience in operationally managing a mixed-level team

Sub Job Family Description:
Develops and implements the organization's positions on environmental policy issues regarding the impact of the organization's operations on water, air and land quality. Designs and implements programs to ensure healthful and safe working conditions and compliance with all environmental regulations, including clean air and hazardous waste disposal, on the organization's premises. Serves as a liaison with external government environmental agencies. Monitors programs and maintains up-to-date records required by environmental permits to ensure government compliance.

And/or designs, develops, implements and oversees the organization's safety or preventive health care programs to safeguard employees. Ensures that all facilities and safety equipement are in compliance with regulations, fire safety standards. Determine and provide employees with safety training and/or medical care/nursing care for the comfort and well-being of employees. Conducts studies and investigations and prepares regular reports/ statistics of e.g. accidents and indicidents to determine the root cause and to develop recommendations for prevention. Develops and provides safety performance measures for monitoring. Maintains comprehensive knowledge of government safety and fire safety regulations or occupation health.
Job Profile Description: Designs, develops, implements and oversees the organization's environmental, health and safety programs and procedures to safeguard employees and surrounding communities and to ensure that all facilities are in compliance with regulations | Responsibilities are within the Environmental Health and Safety Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines
Role Description:
● Has proficiency through job-related training and considerable work experience
● Completes work with a limited degree of supervision; regularly provides guidance to others with less experience
● May act as an informal resource for colleagues with less experience
Grade Differentiatior:
● Has proficiency through job-related training and considerable work experience
● Completes work with a limited degree of supervision; regularly provides guidance to others with less experience
● May act as an informal resource for colleagues with less experience
Qualifications: Vocational training in e.g. manual or technical  field or equivalent work experience. 0-4 years of experience

Sub Job Family Description: Develops policies, procedures and methods to evaluate and improve the quality of products, materials, components and/or operations. Develops, assures and maintains the quality of products and processes, including standard procedures (e.g., ISO 9001:2000, ISO 14000 family of standards or other certifications). Conducts quality audits/reviews. Applies methods/ procedures to develop, ensure & improve sustainable quality.
Job Profile Description: Develops policies, procedures and methods to evaluate and improve the quality of products, materials, components and/or operations | Develops, assures and maintains the quality of products and processes, including standard procedures (e.g., ISO 9001:2000, ISO 14000 family of standards), quality audits/review, Taguchi methods, process reengineering, etc. | Manages the relationship with customers, suppliers, authority bodies | Responsibilities are within the Quality Assurance Methods Function as a generalist or in a combination of Disciplines.
Role Description:
● Provides leadership and direction through Senior Managers and Managers
● Has accountability for the performance and results of:
● A large, strategically important discipline in an extremely large market; and/or
● Related disciplines or a medium-sized function in a large market or medium-sized division; and/or
● A medium-sized discipline or department in a major region
● Adapts and executes functional or departmental business plans and contributes to the development of functional or departmental strategies
● Decisions are guided by functional or major operational segment strategies and priorities
Grade Differentiatior:
● Provides leadership and direction through Senior Managers and Managers respectively Senior Experts and Experts
● Has accountability for the performance and results of:
● A large, strategically important discipline in an extremely large market; and/or
● Related disciplines or a medium-sized function in a large market or medium-sized division; and/or
● A medium-sized discipline or department in a major region
● Adapts and executes functional or departmental business plans and contributes to the development of functional or departmental strategies
● Decisions are guided by functional or major operational segment strategies and priorities
Qualifications: University degree or equivalent and 2-4 years of work experience or equivalent
Specific parameters KPIs:
University degree or equivalent and 10-15 years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in management of a global function or major region including setting the respective strategy

● Provides leadership to managers; may also provide leadership to supervisors and/or professional staff
● Has accountability for the performance and results of multiple related units
● Develops departmental plans, including business, production, operational and/or organizational priorities
● Controls resources and policy formation in area of responsibility
● Decisions are guided by resource availability and functional objectives
Grade Differentiatior:

● Develops plans and delivers results in fast-changing businesses and/or regulatory environments
● Provides input to functional or departmental strategy
● Manages large, potentially diverse teams of managers and/or senior professionals
Qualifications:
University degree or equivalent and 10+ years of work experience or equivalent
Profound experience in managing performance and results of diverse activities / multiple teams

● Has accountability for the performance and results of a team within own discipline or function

● Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance from senior manager
● Provides technical guidance to employees, colleagues and/or customers
Grade Differentiatior:

Sub Job Family Description: Develops and implements methods and procedures for process control, process improvement, testing and inspection to ensure that the products are free of flaws and function as designed. Designs and installs sophisticated testing equipment and performs product testing and analysis to maintain quality levels and minimize defects and failure rates. Analyzes reports and defective products to determine trends and recommend corrective actions. Collaborates with supplier representatives on quality problems, ensures that effective corrective actions are implemented and contributes to supplier quality improvement programs
Job Profile Description: Develops and implements methods and procedures for process control, process improvement, testing and inspection to ensure that the products are free of flaws and function as designed | Designs and installs sophisticated testing equipment and performs product testing and analysis to maintain quality levels and minimize defects and failure rates | Analyzes reports and defective products to determine trends and recommend corrective actions | Collaborates with supplier representatives on quality problems, ensures that effective corrective actions are implemented and contributes to supplier quality improvement programs

● Is recognized as an expert in own area within the organization

● Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations
● Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of business requirement

● Guides others in resolving complex issues in own specialized area and solves complex problems with implications on cross-functional business processes and outcomes
● Serves as an advisor and applies knowledge of strategies that can be deployed within own function and discipline

● May lead teams or projects with broad visibility
Qualifications: University degree or equivalent and 2-4 years of work experience or equivalent
